body: I don't think it would make sense to reuse `ORM\Index` for this, because having a `fields` or `columns` property would make no sense in this case. Maybe introducing `ORM\Indexed` would be better?

> Maybe introducing ORM\Indexed would be better?

Yeah that would work too.

Indexes potentially need more info than unique right? Like flags and options? An alternative would be adding it to `Column`:
```php
#[Column(index: true, indexFlags: [], indexOptions: [])]
```
Flags and options would be optional, so I think in 99% of cases just adding `index: true` would suffice.

People should be able to specify a custom index name as well. Also, the interface you propose is a bit flawed as it allows for nonsensical stuf like `(index: false, indexFlags: ['some flags'])`

We could also consider nesting, since it makes no sense to have the `Index` or `Indexed` if there is no `Column`.
`#[Column(index: new Index(name: 'custom_name', flags: ["some", "flags], options: ["some", options"]))]`

`index` could be typed with `bool|Index` so that the shortcut you propose is possible.

> We could also consider nesting:
#[Column(index: new Index(name: 'custom_name', indexFlags: ["some", "flags], indexOptions: ["some", options"]))]

Ooh that would be very nice. Would also be consistent with things like `joinColumns` on the `JoinTable` attribute. My only concern is how can we prevent namespace collision with the existing `Index` attribute? Or would the existing `Index` attribute be used for this? If so, then we have the issue again of nonsensical fields such as `fields` and `columns`.

> the interface you propose is a bit flawed as it allows for nonsensical stuf like (index: false, indexFlags: ['some flags'])

Same is true for any other existing mapping attribute that accepts an array in any argument. My thought process was just to keep things consistent with the current options that already exist, such as the existing `unique` flag on `Column`.

But if that is not a primary concern, then my preference goes towards your options of either a new `Indexed` attribute or adding the nested `Index` in `Column`.

If we can agree on what it'd look like for users, I could investigate the implementation details for the schema tool and create a PR.
Let's maybe use nested attributes with `index: bool|ColumnIndex` to avoid collisions?

@greg0ire PR created. #11988 

I can also add docs once the implementation is approved.
I'd rather you start with the docs than with the code, to be honest :P
Fair enough, I suppose I've been burnt too many times by wasting my time on writing docs and then not having the implementation approved for months, or ever. ðŸ˜†

issue.title: Simple annotation for single-column index
